feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operational reality summary for "daily wage calculator" based on Jira evidence: - Findings / issues / limitations: 21 - Troubleshooting / edge cases / requests: 19 - Evidence suggests asynchronous updates or synchronization considerations. - Evidence includes UI/visibility or copy/label concerns.

findings.group_description: Client requires an automated salary calculation system based on 26 working days per month, with dynamic adjustments for extra or fewer worked days.
findings.issue_explanation: The current payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days, requiring manual tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves.
findings.limitation_statement: The system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking.
findings.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation that prevents dynamic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee.

findings.group_description: Daily wage calculator in payroll settings overrides leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations
findings.issue_explanation: The system allows payroll settings to take precedence over leave policy formula, with the leave policy formula appearing greyed out to indicate it is being overridden
findings.limitation_statement: Users cannot synchronize daily wage formulas between leave policy and payroll modules automatically
findings.gap_statement: No mechanism exists for automatic formula alignment between leave policy and payroll configurations

findings.group_description: System fails to automatically update unpaid leave deductions when salary configurations change after leave request creation
findings.issue_explanation: Deductions were calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in incorrect payroll deduction amounts
findings.limitation_statement: Cannot automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when salary configurations are updated after leave request submission
findings.gap_statement: Lacks dynamic salary configuration handling for automatically updating pending leave deductions

findings.group_description: The daily wage calculator fails to correctly handle leap year calculations, specifically for the year 2024, which impacts End of Service (EOS) gratuity computations.
findings.issue_explanation: The system is incorrectly calculating service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in a lower gratuity amount for employees with service spanning the leap year.
findings.limitation_statement: The calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years in service period computations.
findings.gap_statement: The system requires enhancement to dynamically recognize and incorporate 366-day years in service period calculations.

findings.group_description: End of Service (EOS) pro-rated amount calculation produces consistently lower amounts due to decimal precision errors
findings.issue_explanation: When calculating daily wage for pro-rated EOS amounts, the system shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimal points, affecting all employees regardless of departure date
findings.limitation_statement: The daily wage calculation formula (basic + allowances / 30) produces systematically undercalculated pro-rated amounts
findings.gap_statement: The system needs enhanced rounding and decimal handling mechanisms to ensure exact financial calculations

findings.group_description: System handles leave accrual with monthly policy that does not prorate or include partial month leave balances
findings.issue_explanation: Leave days are accrued at end of month, so mid-month departures do not receive current month's leave balance
findings.limitation_statement: Cannot automatically include leave days for incomplete months of employment
findings.gap_statement: No automatic prorated leave accrual for employees departing mid-month

findings.group_description: End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculation uses tiered daily wage formula with different rates for service duration
findings.issue_explanation: Gratuity calculated using different daily rates: 21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year after 5 years, with prorated calculation for partial years
findings.limitation_statement: Calculation requires manual verification and potential manual adjustment for edge cases

findings.group_description: System's gratuity calculation shows minor differences when handling leap year days and service duration counting
findings.issue_explanation: The platform calculates service days slightly differently from manual calculations, specifically around February 29th and departure date inclusion
findings.limitation_statement: The system's gratuity calculation methodology is not transparently documented for leap year day inclusion and service duration counting
findings.gap_statement: Need for clear user-facing explanation of gratuity calculation methodology, including leap years and departure date handling

findings.group_description: The daily wage calculator's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling service periods, especially for partial years and leap year adjustments.
findings.issue_explanation: The system calculates gratuity using a nuanced approach that differs from manual expectations, specifically in handling partial years above 5 years of service and leap year day counting.
findings.limitation_statement: The current gratuity calculation methodology is not transparently communicated, leading to potential misunderstandings about how partial years and leap years are processed.
findings.gap_statement: There is a need for a more detailed, user-friendly explanation of the gratuity calculation logic, including worked examples showing how service duration is calculated for partial years and leap year handling.

findings.group_description: The daily wage calculation method is hardcoded with a fixed 30-day divisor and does not support alternative calculation formulas.
findings.issue_explanation: The platform uses a fixed formula of (Basic Salary / 30) for daily wage calculation, which cannot be modified or configured to alternative methods like (Basic Salary × 12 / 365).
findings.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses a hardcoded divisor of 30 days, preventing customization of the calculation method.
findings.gap_statement: The system lacks flexibility in gratuity calculation methods, specifically in daily wage computation for different organizational preferences.

findings.group_description: Daily wage calculation involves complex policy-driven configuration that may not align with user expectations about prorated salary computation.
findings.issue_explanation: Users misunderstand how leave salary is calculated based on predefined policy configurations, specifically around daily rate divisors and month-end prorations.
findings.limitation_statement: The platform's leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations, which may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths or specific employee scenarios.
findings.gap_statement: There's a potential product gap in providing more transparent explanations of how leave salary calculations are performed, including clear documentation about daily rate divisor configurations.

findings.group_description: Daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly variations in leave salary accrual calculations
findings.issue_explanation: The leave encashment settings use working days as the divisor, which means the daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals
findings.limitation_statement: The system calculates daily wage using a variable working days method that can produce different accrual amounts month-to-month
findings.gap_statement: The platform lacks a way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months with varying working days

findings.group_description: The daily wage calculator has separate configurations for leave salary and salary proration, which can lead to calculation mismatches.
findings.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing potential calculation discrepancies.
findings.limitation_statement: The system cannot automatically align leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations without manual configuration.
findings.gap_statement: There is no unified daily wage calculation method that consistently applies across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

findings.group_description: Daily wage calculation based on work week configuration with potential misunderstanding of working days logic
findings.issue_explanation: The system calculates daily wage proration based on the employee's configured work week, which can include all 7 days as working days. This can appear incorrect to users who expect traditional weekend exclusions.
findings.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation follows the specific work week configuration, which may include all days as working days

findings.group_description: System has inconsistent salary proration behavior for offboarded employees based on departure date timing
findings.issue_explanation: When an employee's departure date is set in the future but payroll is processed earlier, the system fails to prorate the salary and displays the full monthly amount instead of a prorated amount
findings.limitation_statement: The daily wage calculator cannot consistently prorate salaries across different departure date scenarios
findings.gap_statement: The system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic that can handle salary calculations for employees with future departure dates

findings.group_description: System fails to properly manage payroll deductions when unpaid leave transactions are modified or deleted
findings.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.
findings.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems
findings.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions

findings.group_description: System experiences data synchronization issues when calculating daily wage, particularly around public holiday timing and working days calculation
findings.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes inconsistent between HR and Payroll systems, resulting in incorrect salary deductions
findings.limitation_statement: The system cannot automatically recalculate daily wage deductions retroactively when public holiday configurations change
findings.gap_statement: Lack of real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules prevents accurate working days calculation

findings.group_description: The daily wage calculator uses a non-standard divisor (30.42 days) for unpaid leave deductions, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations.
findings.issue_explanation: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions by dividing monthly salary by 30.42 days, resulting in daily rates that may not precisely match user expectations of a full month's salary deduction.
findings.limitation_statement: The system uses a custom daily wage divisor that does not align with calendar days, potentially causing confusion in payroll deduction calculations.
findings.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for the 30.42 days divisor and how it impacts unpaid leave deductions.

findings.group_description: Incorrect display of daily rate calculation details in remarks section, specifically for February calculations
findings.issue_explanation: The system shows an incorrect daily rate in remarks (925.81 based on 31 days) instead of the correct rate (989.66 based on 29 days for February), even though the actual deduction calculation is mathematically correct
findings.limitation_statement: Remarks field does not dynamically adjust to actual calendar days for different months, particularly for February in leap years
findings.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on actual month days

findings.group_description: Global daily rate configuration overrides policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
findings.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes individual leave policy settings, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions
findings.limitation_statement: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists
findings.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited flexibility in handling nuanced leave policy configurations

findings.group_description: System displays daily wage rate from payroll processing month instead of leave occurrence month, causing user confusion
findings.issue_explanation: The daily rate displayed does not match the month when leave was actually taken, showing the rate from the payroll processing month instead of the leave occurrence month
findings.limitation_statement: The system recalculates daily rates based on payroll processing month, not preserving the original leave occurrence month rate
findings.gap_statement: Need for a consistent daily rate display mechanism that stores and shows the initially calculated rate at leave request time

troubleshooting.group_description: Workaround for lack of automated daily wage calculation involves manual tracking of employee attendance and overtime.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Use a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime tracking separately for each employee, with manual adjustments to salary.

troubleshooting.group_description: Resolving discrepancies in daily wage formula configuration across system modules
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Configure daily wage calculator in payroll settings first, which will override leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations

troubleshooting.group_description: Manual process to correct incorrect unpaid leave deduction calculations
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the existing leave request and recreate it if the deduction has not been processed yet

troubleshooting.group_description: Workaround involves manually verifying leap year calculations and cross-checking with MOHRE guidelines.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate total service days, ensuring 366 days are used for 2024, and verify the gratuity amount against official guidelines.

troubleshooting.group_description: Users should double-check final settlement amounts and report discrepancies to support
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Escalate to development team for precise calculation review and correction

troubleshooting.group_description: When leave balance cannot be automatically included for mid-month departure, manual adjustment is possible
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Admin can manually adjust EOS balance in the EOS section. Alternatively, change accrual policy to conditional (daily) instead of monthly.

troubleshooting.group_description: Users can manually verify and potentially override gratuity calculations
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate and compare gratuity amount, with ability to edit the system-generated value if discrepancy is found

troubleshooting.group_description: Detailed explanation of how the system calculates gratuity for service periods spanning multiple years, especially partial years and leap years.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually break down the service period into segments: first 5 years at 21 days per year, subsequent full years at 30 days per year, and partial years prorated by actual days divided by 366 (for leap years) or 365 (for non-leap years).

troubleshooting.group_description: Users must manually adjust calculations due to system's fixed daily wage computation method.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate daily wage using alternative formulas outside the system, then input final gratuity amount.

troubleshooting.group_description: Users experiencing discrepancies in leave salary calculations should verify the current policy configuration.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Verify actual deduction amount by calculating daily rate using correct calendar days for the specific month

troubleshooting.group_description: Users can address daily wage calculation variations by changing leave encashment settings
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: If consistent calculations are desired, switch from 'working days' to 'custom days' setting for leave encashments

troubleshooting.group_description: Users need to manually align daily wage configurations for consistent calculations across leave salary and salary proration.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Verify and manually configure both leave salary and salary proration daily wage settings to use the same divisor and calculation method.

troubleshooting.group_description: Verify work week settings to understand daily wage calculation
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Check employee work week configuration to confirm why all 31 days are considered working days

troubleshooting.group_description: Manual intervention required to correctly prorate salaries for offboarded employees
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate prorated salary by dividing monthly salary by 30 and multiplying by days worked (e.g., 21,000/30 * 15 = AED 10,500 for 15 days)

troubleshooting.group_description: Manual intervention required to resolve duplicate payroll deductions caused by leave transaction modifications
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually remove duplicate deductions created after modifying or deleting leave transactions

troubleshooting.group_description: When daily wage calculation produces incorrect results due to public holiday timing, manual intervention is the only current resolution
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Create a manual deduction to correct the salary calculation when automatic calculation fails

troubleshooting.group_description: When unpaid leave deductions produce unexpected results, manual reconciliation may be required to balance payroll calculations.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Payroll representatives may need to manually add or adjust amounts to bring the total payable to the expected value.

troubleshooting.group_description: Verify global daily rate configuration when investigating unpaid leave deductions
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Check the global daily rate configuration which overrides policy-level calculations

troubleshooting.group_description: Resolving confusion around daily rate calculation and display across different payroll months
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: System deployed a fix to store the initially calculated daily rate and display that amount instead of recalculating every time

glossary.definition: A standard of 26 working days per month used as the basis for salary calculation, derived from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days per year.
The calculated per-day monetary value derived from an employee's basic monthly salary, used in gratuity and end-of-service benefit calculations.
Calculation of salary reduction for days an employee takes leave without pay, typically computed as (total_salary/30.41) * number of unpaid leave days

A financial benefit calculated based on an employee's total service period, typically computed using daily wage and years of service, with specific calculation rules for different service duration brackets.
A year containing 366 days instead of the standard 365 days, occurring every 4 years (with some exceptions), which can impact calculations involving days and service periods.
A proportional salary calculation for partial month periods, typically calculated by dividing total salary by 30 and multiplying by days worked
Leave days are earned and credited at the end of each month, not prorated for partial months
Leave days are earned daily instead of being credited at month-end, allowing more flexible prorating
Total number of days worked, calculated by counting from start date to departure date, including potential leap year considerations
The process of computing end-of-service benefits for an employee based on their salary, length of service, and applicable labor regulations.
The number of days used to divide monthly salary to calculate a daily wage rate, which can be configured in leave policy settings (e.g., 30 or 31 calendar days).
Cumulative calculation of vacation leave monetary value, which can vary based on the number of working days in a given month
Calculation of salary based on the number of days worked, typically using a divisor to determine the daily rate (e.g., Basic salary + allowances / 30.42 days).
Prorating an employee's salary during periods of leave, which may use a different calculation method from regular salary proration.
A partial salary calculation based on the exact number of days worked, typically used when an employee joins or leaves mid-month
A system-configured value (30.42 days) used to calculate daily wage rates for payroll deductions, which differs from standard calendar days.
Total number of days in a specific month, which can vary (e.g., 29 days in February during a leap year)
A system-wide setting that determines how daily wage deductions are calculated, which takes precedence over individual policy configurations
